item.description: About The Archive of Formal Proofs is a collection of proof libraries, examples, and larger scientific developments, mechanically checked in the theorem prover Isabelle. It is organized in the way of a scientific journal. Submissions are refereed. The archive repository is hosted on Heptapod to provide easy free access to archive entries. The entries are tested and maintained continuously against the current stable release of Isabelle. Older versions of archive entries will remain available.

item.title: AFP Submission
item.description: Submission Guidelines (Jump to submission form) The submission must build with the current Isabelle release version. Submissions for older Isabelle versions are not accepted. Submissions for the Isabelle development version are also acceptable, but publication of the entry on the front page will be deferred until the next Isabelle release. In the meantime the entry will only be visible on the development pages. In this case, submit your article as described above.

item.title: Citing Entries
item.description: The following gives an example of the preferred way for citing entries in the AFP: M. Jaskelioff and S. Merz, Proving the Correctness of Disk Paxos. Archive of Formal Proofs, June 2005, http://isa-afp.org/entries/DiskPaxos.html, Formal proof development. The bibtext entry for this would be: @article{Jaskelioff-Merz-AFP05, author = {Mauro Jaskelioff and Stephan Merz}, title = {Proving the Correctness of Disk Paxos}, journal = {Archive of Formal Proofs}, month = Jun, year = 2005, note = {\url{http://isa-afp.

item.title: Download the Archive
item.description: Current stable version (for current Isabelle release): afp-current.tar.gz Older stable versions: Please use the sourceforge download system to access older versions of the archive. Mercurial access: At Heptapod (development version of the Archive, for the development version of Isabelle) How to refer to AFP entries: You can refer to AFP entries by using the AFP as an Isabelle component. The AFP repository is hosted on Heptapod, a friendly fork of GitLab for Mercurial provided by Octobus and Clever Cloud.

item.title: Referring to AFP Entries
item.description: Once you have downloaded the AFP, you can include its articles and theories in your own developments. If you would like to make your work available to others without having to include the AFP articles you depend on, here is how to do it. If you are using Isabelle2020, and have downloaded your AFP directory to /home/myself/afp, you should run the following command [1] to make the AFP session ROOTS available to Isabelle:

item.title: Statistics
item.description: Statistics Number of Articles: 561 Number of Authors: 366 Number of lemmas: ~153,600 Lines of Code:~2,666,700 Most used AFP articles: Name Used by ? articles 1. List-Index 15 2. Coinductive 12 3. Collections 12 4. Regular-Sets 12 5. Landau_Symbols 11 6. Polynomial_Factorization 10 7. Show 10 8.

item.title: Submission Guidelines
item.description: Please send your submission via this web page. The submission must follow the following Isabelle style rules. For additional guidelines on Isabelle proofs, also see the this guide (feel free to follow all of these; only the below are mandatory). Technical details about the submission process and the format of the submission are explained on the submission site. No use of the commands sorry or back. Instantiations must not use Isabelle-generated names such as xa — use Isar, the subgoal command or rename_tac to avoid such names.

item.title: Updating Entries
item.description: Change The Archive of Formal Proofs is an online resource and therefore more dynamic than a normal scientific journal. Existing entries can and do evolve and can also be updated significantly by their authors. This conflicts with the purpose of archiving and preserving entries as they have been submitted and with the purpose of providing a clear and simple interface to readers. The AFP deals with this by synchronizing such updates with Isabelle releases:
